references.paper_title: Prevalence of neural collapse during the terminal phase of deep learning training
references.reason: This paper is the foundational work that first identified and characterized the phenomenon of neural collapse, which this paper extends to the context of regression.

references.paper_title: Exploring deep neural networks via layer-peeled model: Minority collapse in imbalanced training
references.reason: This paper introduced the layered-peeled model, a theoretical framework that helps explain neural collapse and is used in this paper to explain neural regression collapse.

This paper introduced the unconstrained feature model (UFM), a simplified model that allows for a theoretical understanding of neural collapse and is crucial to the theoretical analysis in this paper.

references.paper_title: On the optimization landscape of neural collapse under MSE loss: Global optimality with unconstrained features
references.reason: This paper provides important theoretical results on the optimization landscape of neural collapse under MSE loss, which are leveraged in this paper's theoretical analysis.

references.paper_title: Neural collapse under MSE loss: Proximity to and dynamics on the central path
references.reason: This paper offers additional theoretical insights into neural collapse under MSE loss, complementing the results from Zhou et al. and contributing to the theoretical foundation of this paper.
